We did not really care as we dont like these magnifying mirrors... :) The next day, when we got back to our room I found a letter from The Hotel Manager apologizing for this situation. I have stayed in tons of hotels around the world and never experienced such thing. Well done! Thank you so much for everything and see you all on my nex trip in May!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in all departments”
Reviews.Author: SharkyCornwall
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the internet with this hotel. Stayed for a long weekend. This is a good location to stay when visiting London. A quiet clean and safe environment with good links via DLR - Jubilee line - fast ferry to central London. The hotel lived up to our expectations in every department. The only short coming was the lack of free WiFi which should be standard fare today. Room quality was great for London with plenty of space and quality furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect of a Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgansnan
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here last weekend as part of a coach tour visiting the theatre. Check in was friendly and efficient. We were given a room on the 4th floor which was spacious and clean - not much of a view, overlooking a new wing under construction, however we didn't spend enough time in the room to worry about it. The room was surprisingly quiet, don't know whether we were lucky and had quiet neighbours or whether the rooms are well insulated. We had all the usual facilities, including tea & coffee making, complimentary toiletries etc. It was an ideal base for us as we wanted to visit Greenwich and the DLR runs right outside. Would recommend it if you want to visit the O2 etc but a little far out for the central London attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: casey+jenny
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel! In the centre of Canary Wharf, great location to get to all the offices of Canary Wharf and a 5 minute walk to the Canary Wharf Shopping and the tube station! The reception of this hotel is lovely! very bright and airey. Clean and modern! looks as though the refurbishment has only just taken place when i think it has been like this for a while now! The Staff throughout the whole hotel are really good at the hotel very friendly and helpful! We stayed in an executive room on the 13th floor and the executive lounge is great with refreshments avalible through the day and alcholic drinks in the evening. The view in the lounge is also great across London. I would recomend this hotel for both buisness and leisure! as the weekends in Canary wharf area are a lot more busy than it used to be! I would recomend this resturant at this hotel to anyone in the area aswel! the food was amazing! the staff were really attentive and friendly! Cocktails from the bar also very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NJ26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel and it was everything we could have asked for. Welcoming lobby with friendly and helpful staff and the room was perfect. A very modern and maintained feel, clean, big and comfortable bed. The breakfast was one of the best hotel buffets I have ever had. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: JennyIceland
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to London and I had NO idea where to stay, since I was traveling with my son, who is 12. After many hours of looking online for the best place to stay, I certainly found it with this hotel. First of all, the hotel is located a few minutes walk from the Canary Wharf tube stations/DLR, and once on the trains from there, you are a 20-30 min ride to all the major sites. For example, Camden town and Buckingham palace are less than 25 min away. Close to the hotel are little corner stores, like Tesco, for some evening treats and you are a few min walk to Jubilee shopping mall and many other shopping centres with well-known stores like the Gap, etc. The hotel is clean and the breakfast buffet was great and included in the price of the room. The hotel staff was great....they were kind and polite and helped me out when i forgot my plug adapter ;) they brought us up utensils when we needed them and gave us great directions to local attractions. The beds? Comfy, clean.... I did my little inspection of the room before we settled in....A-1! The price was fantastic and cost 400usd for three nights (71 pounds per night) which was much lower than many other hotels I researched. Next time in London, I will stay here. I had a great time and happy with my trip.....going back this summer/fall!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended hotel for the O2”
Reviews.Author: Towni
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel are all correct in their rating, my wife stayed in a another Hilton the week before which was a 5 star in central London and was pleasantly surprised that this hotel was so good. Easy transport links to central London and the O2, which is why we chose this hotel, close to shops and restaurants in Canary Wharf you can't go wrong booking this hotel. Only negative thing was the breakfast buffet style, the bacon is ROCK HARD, but as so much is being cooked there's no choice really, and the rolling toasting machine I had to double pass my bread through it to get it to go brown, it felt like Russian roulette would brown or would it burst in to flames on the second pass. The room we had was a large but the bathroom was small which is how they made the room so big, nice and quiet and clean, you couldn't hear the DLR outside which made our night's sleep after our day at the O2 very nice to end on.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine treat”
Reviews.Author: MyBeemer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well within an easy commute to the O2 arena. My wife and I found the staff, very pleasant, knowledgeable and welcoming. The Double Deluxe room was spacious, clean and well laid out! The buffet breakfast was excellent in its choice of both hot and cold food. And although, the DLR train line runs directly opposite the hotel, any noise is non-existent. Overall, a thoroughly wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: psmCardiff Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel excellent and no complaints. I suppose the distance from central London but there is a the river boat taxi service nearby into central london which we used.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hilton”
Reviews.Author: richles
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since they first opened and it is my favourite Hilton. Yes, I know it is way out of the centre, but have some imagination!! The architecture in the area is fantastic with great city and river walks all around. If you want to walk in parkland get on the DLR which is just outside the hotel and the whole of London is your lobster (oyster!). Great access to the Jubilee line, and make sure you get the river bus into central London just once, the city looks totally different from the river. Great shopping nearby and the area is choc full of restaurants of every type. The hotel is charming; the staff are always excellent, friendly, polite and efficient. At the weekend there are often weddings and functions on which liven the place up. Chelsea FC and others stay there before a match night and so you can do a little “celeb watch” I am a gold card member and have always been upgraded to an exec room, one slight niggle though Hilton seem to be closing the exec bar earlier and earlier. The rooms are a good size with the expected toiletries, dressing gown, slippers and water replaced every day. We were given a suite once and that was fantastic, I wanted to move in. I tend not to eat in the hotel as there is so much choice outside but have had dinner once, a sandwich lunch a couple of times and it has always been very good. There is an excellent Indian in the next block which is usually full of Indians, always a good sign, sorry I can’t remember it’s name (the Bengal something I think?) I cannot rate The Hilton Canary Wharf highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value If Just A Comfy Bed Required For The Night But That's All.”
Reviews.Author: healerguy
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel as it was near to where I did business but would definitely choose somewhere else next time, even if it cost me more. Although I had a comfortable bed, my sleep was occasionally disturbed by the intrusive sound from the air con unit. I eventually had to get up and turn it off completely but then awoke earlier than intended, to a stuffy and warm atmosphere, not being able to open a window even if I wanted to in the middle of Winter, which I really felt like in order to breath more easily. I looked forward to my inclusive breakfast but it was spoiled by my supposed hard boiled egg pouring out over my plate as soon as I started to remove the shell ! I don't like my tea too strong but I had to ask a waiter for a fresh pot of tea with two tea bags as one in a pot, that held enough water for three cups, was a little TOO weak for me, it would have been nice to have a choice as in most other establishments of this category in preference to a 'take it or leave it' expectation. I also resented the idea of having to wait 15 minutes in the long queue for a cooked breakfast, served painfully slowly and inadequately by just two staff, and for a potential couple of hundred guests too ! I thought my dinner the previous evening was bad enough, I had the 'special offer' set menu for £23+ which was 50% inedible due to Patti that tasted off and potato that had a strong taste of cooking fat that was long overdue for a change and made me feel quite sick. Having survived all that (but not without an upset tummy for two days after), I had to convince Reception that I was charged an additional £4+ for something I didn't have at dinner, even though it had a completely different table number on the bill ! Nor that I had drank a small can of diet Lemonade from my minibar, such drinks of which I especially deplore due to their inclusion of harmful 'Artificial Sweeteners' (Google the detrimental health effects of Aspartame). However, for anyone whom maybe hard of hearing and not too fussy about their food or final bill accuracy, as far as London hotel prices are concerned, I consider £85 room and breakfast plus £20 secure parking fee not too extortionate, it's just a pity attention to detail and customer service, to me at least, appears to be very lacking and, on the whole, more reminiscent of a 3 star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in London”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because they had a very good weekend package and because we had never stayed in Canary Wharf. The first room we got was on a smoking floor and though it was a non smoking room you could still smell tobacco. When asked the reception if we could change they immediately gave us a new room on another floor. The room was very spacious by London standards, quiet and clean. The breakfast was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Petitpoussin
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is by far the best accommodation we have stayed in London. It's a great location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: Fomas
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel. It's in a fairly good location with Canary Wharf tube being 5 mins walk away and so good for going into central. Rooms are huge for the price, the only problem is that they are so big that they look a little empty. Furniture that is in there though is modern and quite stylish. Had a great night, slept well and capped it off by a huge english breakfast that's included in the price. BARGIN!

Reviews.Title: “Complete satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: kikaan
Reviews.Content: We took our grandson on a long week-end to London and took advantage of Hilton's week end offer. We enjoyed the spacious room, well presented varied breakfast buffet included in the offer. Grandson enjoyed steamroom and fitness facilities. Had a delicious room service dinner the first evening Underground metro is next door or Jubilee line from Canary wharf a little distance away. Very attentive,helpful, polite staff. We recommend the young Asian woman-receptionist with difficult name Yau....

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: DazMan1988
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in The Hilton Canary Wharf over the weekend of the 28th January, and loved it! We took advantage of the special offer available, and splashed out on a Junior Suite, we thought why not as the deal was so good...and we were not disappointed! With full access to the Executive suite on the 14th floor, including complementary afternoon tea, happy hour (unlike any other happy hour, here EVERY drink was included!) Breakfast was excellent, as many other reviewers have already commented, great selection, and a great way to start the day. The only thing we didn't take advantage of was the gym and steam room facilities, but these were also included in the price we paid...awesome! A note on the room, the junior suite was advertised to be double the size of a standard double guest room...and that was no lie, it was huge! the only down side was, that as we checked in, we were directed instantly to the executive lounge on the top floor, where we hoped our room would be situated...unfortunately we were only on the 5th floor. Request a high floor room if you can, the DLR does create a faint grumble everytime it goes past...BUT not worth complaining about, the triple + glazing and soundproofing does a pretty good job. All in all, a very plush hotel in a very good location with easy access to central London. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon8
Reviews.Content: Weekend break to meet up with family & visit O2 show. Hotel modern & clean, pleasant spacious room with great river views. Bathroom good with separate shower plus lovely bath. A potential allergy problem with feather pillows & duvet, only stayed couple of nights so survived without too much sneezing! Excellent variety of hot & cold food for breakfast. Location convenient for DLR & Jubilee Line with modern shops & cafes/bars of Canary Wharf close by & Historic Greenwich couple of stops away on DLR.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT IT MADE MY DAY SO SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: pinkrose351
Reviews.Content: It was great we went on our Anniversary it was a surprise gift for my husband from me but when we got there Hilton surprised both of us they really made our day special we would like to say thanks to all the staff for making our special day even more special ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: BobReh
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly! I arrived two hours before checkin, and the staff was ultra-friendly and let me have my room anyways! They called me by my first name, and was very helpful with the problems I got. Breakfeast was excellent! All in all, I would really recommend this hotel for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, LOVED THE BEDROOM.MODERN AND CLEAN.”
Reviews.Author: LESLEY_ANNScotland
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and commuted to central London for West End show. The subway is a 15mins ride. Very easy to do. We loved the hotel, very modern and clean. We also found the shops at Canary Wharf (which is just across a footbridge- 2 mins away) to be excellent. We also ate there at night and found the "Gourmet Burger" restaurant hit the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely rooms, yummy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lady46
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean easily accessible by car. When I booked i wasnt sure of location but neednt have worried, 4 minute easy walk over footbridge to canary wharf tube station. Close to lovely restaurants and the o2 which is where we went. Really good breakfast. The only slight down side to a really good hotel was the service, fire alarm went off sunday morning and the organisation of guests was appalling, didnt feel re-assured at all while waiting outside, didnt know where assembly point was. No management seemed to be present. A real shame as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 89tinker89
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel after staying for two nights,right in the centre of Canary Wharf near tube station and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money hotel with great links to central London”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamHolidayer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister for 3 nights over New Years and could not have picked a better location in London for value for money. Provided the Jubilee Line/DLR is running it is literally a couple of minutes from the station so easy to access Central London. Room was enormous, I stay in a lot of hotels and this was one of the biggest, very clean and tidy. The bed was comfy. Staff could not have been nicer. All in all an incredibly pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice if you travel through City airport”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: Booked there because we were travelling through City and price was OK. Rooms are large ennough but the bathroom is not up to the standard of the hotel (very small and inconvenient) and the "king size" must painfully reach about 1.6 meters wide! Nevertheless, the room is pleasant and quiet. There is a small sauna but no space to sit and relax afterwards which is a pity. Location is not too bad but if you need to go in central London it will imply a roughly 30 minutes ride and a t least one change. There are many dining options and in the immediate vicinity though.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Knew About This Hotel Before”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - modern, new, clean, and in a perfect location for me. 5 minute walk to our office here, and 5 minutes to Jubilee Place or Canada Square shopping, right on DLR Line South Quay station... Easy to get anywhere in London proper or down to Greenwich, O2, etc. Lots of food choices around too! Breakfast in hotel is pretty good! Only drawback is that there is no wireless in the room and the LAN connection is 15 pounds per day / 75 pounds per week. Compared to the US where internet is free, this is expensive! Given the rate I got I would stay here every time I visit London!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly and great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarkusDY
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We managed to get a great rate on their sale offer. Found the location ideal, really easy to get to the Tube and DLR stations. The hotel is a business hotel, so if your looking for all the leisure trimmings and roaring fireplaces, look elsewhere. This is an ultra-modern, user friendly hotel with great modern, clean and functional bedrooms. Well trained and friendly staff around, who were very helpful. Bed matress a little hard, although this can be forgiven for the rest of the large and luxurious rooms! They have a great functional bathrooms, clean and very good shower. The breakfast is great too, very enjoyable and good fast service. Nothing was a problem! The only downfall was Car Parking, which was expensive and not so easy. It was under the hotel, spaces not clearly marked and shared with an apartment block, so we were a little apprehensive about parking in the wrong area as the hotel only has around 20 of their own spaces. It quite expensive to park your car overnight at £20. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “to much money for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizzie11
Reviews.Content: We could not pay with our creditcard or othercards and had to walk trough very bad weather to go to cashmachine. (we coukd use our cards in every other shop and bar , only Hilton did not accept it) There was no space in the parking of the hotel and we had to park at other hotel parking place 5 min walking away !? It was cold in the corridors and publlic places. The room was fine but the bathroom very small (door could not open totally because of the toilet !?) The staff was not friendly and could not smile ones. You have to pay a lot of money for internet ! Breakfast was okay and people working at the breakfast are very friendly. !! They say it is right next to the O2 Arena but for real it is 20 min drive away...... I will never stay in this hotel again, it was not woth the money we payed for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not good and certainly not for the money they want”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: A bland and uninteresting hotel with a dull decor especially in the corridors. The public areas are cold and uninviting. the rooms have everything and yet nothing outstanding, and they charge for everything and want an outrageous amount for internet access. The food is not great, and then they want astronomical money for this entire experience. No insult to premier inns intended , but you know what ,this hotel seemed to me to be of a similiar standard like a travellig salesman billet, and at six times the price. I would not recommend you stay here. Keep your money in your pocket and find somewhere else. Generally i have noted the hotels in Canary Wharf are grossly over priced and under standard. None of them is exciting or make the most of the location. I will go somewhere else next time i recommend readers also do likewise. Please take note Hilton Group this is not your finest property and i have stayed in a lot of your hotels..some are great and some a really awful and others are disappointing..this one falls into the latter category. Not a happy experience

Reviews.Title: “great view and coverage”
Reviews.Author: amit_email
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in.!! this hotel will give you everything you want and at the prices you want. service was ok. we stayed for 2-3 days, with breakfast not that exciting. could be better. dinner was superb!

Reviews.Title: “high quality hotel close to o2 arena”
Reviews.Author: longhaulin
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay in the canary wharf area As with other hotels in the area this is a very modern building with contemporary styling. Service was of very high standard, genuine 4 star and we received a free upgrade to executive level, even though we aren't in a loyalty scheme. Highly recomended. We booked 11 months in advance to get a good deal. Jubilee line takes you quickly into central london, hotel is convenient for 02 arena

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: meyres
Reviews.Content: Like many others we were staying @ Canary Wharf to go to a concert @ O2. We used our honours points to have a free stay so where only allocated a "guest" rom. Howver immeduiatley on check-in we were upgraded to an executive room. The room was large, clean and very pleasant and of course interesting views. The executive lounge was very welcoming with an excellent selection of light refreshments. The provision of binoculars was a popular touch together with the symbols on the glass marking key poimnts of the London sky-line. We were pleasantly surpirsed by Canary Wharf as a whole and the Hilton is perfectly placed for Greenwhich, O2. I had hoped to book to stay for the Olympics but found they were already ful!!! I do feel the hotel should consider offering a valet car parking service as once their very small car park is full one has to use another hotel car park and when you arrive after a long journey and in our case in the rain and dark finding ones way in an unknown area to another hotel then walking back in heavy rain was a big let down/ Very good hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but prefer the Marriott at West India Quay”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton as we were going to a party in the Attic Bar (fantastic by the way) which is two minutes walk from the Hilton. The hotel is close to the DLR (not as close now they have moved the station, but still very easily accessible) which is great for getting around. Our check-in and first impression of the hotel was tainted by the fact we were asked for photo ID (being on home soil we had none and had not be advised during the booking process that we would need any). So UK travelers, please bear this in mind! There is still nothing on the Hilton's Canary Wharf web page about this requirement that I can see. The rooms are a good size, our view at the back on the third floor was rubbish, but we weren't there for the view. If you're there for more than night ask for a room as high up as possible. Disappointed that in a relative new build, there was still lots of noise pollution from the corridor - I believe all hotel rooms should have an inner door! The bathroom was a good size, although the shower in the bath was a little narrow for my liking. For such a decent sized room the television was on the small side and the reception was rubbish. I was also highly suspicious of the fact I could not get any internet access via my mobile in the room. Blocked? Anyway, the Hilton is a good hotel and Canary Wharf remains my favourite area of London, but I would recommend the Marriott over the Hilton if you plan on staying. The beds are more comfortable and I prefer the location of West India Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: whizzy123
Reviews.Content: Were at an event at the O2 so booked a room here based on good reviews and location ... and we were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room as the hotel wasn't busy and it was fantastic. Large room, elegant decor and great nights sleep. We were in one of the rooms close to the DLR line which was a little concern initially, but we didn't hear anything from outside or from neighbouring rooms/corridors for that matter. The only slight niggle was that the bar was really busy when we returned and there were no seats free!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: AyrApple
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went down for a concert at the o2 we had a lovely time at the hilton they upgraded us to the executive suite free of charge lovely room dressing gowns and towels realy white and thick also slippers and toiletries all provided for you room was lovely realy clean staff great looked after you well they know there job and they do it realy well breakfast was great plenty of choice would love to go again downfall is drinks are very exspensive in the bar but still had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at a very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pwca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights last weekend, wanted to be the O2 Arena side of London for our visit there and wasn't disappointed with the hotel, had booked a junior suite which was huge and well furnished, also enjoyed the use of the Executive Lounge although the choice of breakfast in there was more limited that at other Hilton's I have stayed at when i have had breakfast in the main dining rooms, maybe its less choice due to the exclusivity of the lounge. All the staff I had contact with were efficient, polite and friendly, especially those in the bar and executive lounge, I would happily stay at the hotel again when visiting the O2.

Reviews.Title: “Usually great - not so great this time”
Reviews.Author: Lettonie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, and it's one of my favourites - namely because I have never had a bad night's sleep there, the rooms are large and comfortable and the breakfast is the best selection and quality I have ever had at a London hotel. However, my last stay there on 29 October was less than perfect - check-in took a long time, they had me down for booking two rooms when I only booked one - said they would ring me to confirm this was an error on their part and that I wouldn't be charged and didn't. There was also an African recruitment roadshow going on, with several people crowded around the entrance to the hotel - I had to explain that i was a guest before being allowed into the hotel by a man with a clipboard who guarded the entrance. Also did not get asked if I wanted a free newspaper, and despite requesting a room away from the lifts, was put in a room right by them. The staff here are usually excellent, and I always enjoy my stay here, so will just put these minor flaws down to them having an off weekend. If you can get a decent rate here, and the Jubilee line/DLR are working, I would still recommend this hotel. Much better value and more space for your money than the West End/City.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: qwerty123014
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, will stay again! When we arrived we were upgraded to an executive room (they had double booked our room) The staff were very friendly and professional.The hotel was clean throughout and decorated to a high standard. The only cons would be, there's no parking and the drinks are expensive in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TruerReviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights when visiting london for a sightseeing weekend. The hotel is easy to reach and has a DLR station within a couple of minutes walk and also access to the Tube nearby at Canary Wharf. I would expect the hotel is used mainly by business travellers rather than tourists as it is not as close to the main sights or entertainment districts but most places can be reached within an hour. We chose this hotel partly due to other reviews and because we got to stay for free by using our tesco clubcard vouchers (they can be quadrupled for stays at Hilton). The hotel must be quite new and is very clean and modern. The deluxe room was spacious and comfortable but the bathroom was small in comparison and didn't have a seperate shower cubicle. Although the DLR runs past the hotel, the room was very well sound proofed. Internet access was not included in the rate and was very overpriced considering how common free Wi-Fi has become. Breakfast was included in our rate and was up to Hilton's usual high quality standard with a good variety. I would recommend this hotel particularly to anyone working nearby but if I was going again for leisure, I would perhaps consider the Hilton Tower Bridge as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned comfort”
Reviews.Author: ibook
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Hilton hotel. We chose it since it was well located & at the time a better deal than the hotels nearby. The room was quite basic, good bathroom & shower, and comfortable beds, probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in after the Sheraton. The room carpet seemed a little dated, the room was big but seemed quite empty, it seemed like it could use a little sofa or a second lounge chair. I joined the Hilton Honors program before our stay, but the receptionist did not seem to have added our stay on the account, I did not have the time to follow up with the hotel on it. On the whole the location served us well at the time & we were content with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay just outside downtown London”
Reviews.Author: meganwesley
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Hilton London at Canary Wharf. This hotel is located within the Financial District of the London Docklands, which is an easy 10 minute tram ride from downtown London. The DLR has three convienient stops near the hotel so it made traveling in and out of the city very easy. There are also several moderately priced restaurants (cuisine ranging from English, Italian, Indian and plenty of cafe/deli snack shops) located within a block or two. There is also a small shopping mall located below the financial buildings. As for the hotel itself, it felt very clean and safe. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. The room was very spacious with all the usual ammenities. They also offered two complementary bottles of water (one was still and the other was sparkling), a variety of tea and instant coffee. There is a fully stocked minibar and internet access for a fee.There is a decent sized fitness room as well. My only complaint was that the bed and pillows were very firm, which is not a preference of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicki133
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton due to price & proximity to the O2 as my partner was doing the 'run to the beat' half marathon there. It's just a 2 minute walk to Canary Wharf underground station & the DLR so access to central London is no problem. There are plenty of restaurants in the area some tucked away in the underground shopping areas. The hotel - Staff were very friendly & helpful at check-in and whenever we had a query it was delt with immediately. Our room was large but the bed was just a double which seems very small when you're used too a king! Bathrooms were very clean as was the room. We didn't drink or eat at the hotel as we were out both evenings but breakfast was fantastic! There is a good selection at the buffett but you could order a la carte breakfasts if you wished - to be honest I wouldn't have done this as there was a good choice anyway but the chef was obviously bored and made a beeline for me so I decided I'd try one of his omelettes. So glad a did! My partner ended up trying french toast which was also lovely. We were so full but then to our surprise the chef appeared at our table with one of his specailities - waffles with fresh fruit & cream! It was devine! I would definately go back to this hotel & most likely will be next September!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Care Well Appointed Room”
Reviews.Author: EdTed
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the Hilton Canary Wharf. A very smooth check in, great customer care and attention. It was a Sunday and i needed to grab an email and even though i wasn't an executive customer they let me use a computer for 5 mins in the executive lounge. Nice room, well appointed, good selection of extras from bathroom extras to mineral water etc. Nice views overlooking canary wharf. Great breakfast, fantastic selection - pretty much everything you could think of to eat for breakfast was there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Executive Lounge and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: efal
Reviews.Content: My spouse's business trip to London was an opportunity for a 5-day leisure time for me. We stayed at the Hilton Canary Wharf due to the short distance to my husband's company HQs. We arrived on Monday afternoon, check-in was smooth and the room was spacious and with several amenities (bathrobes, slippers, Crabtree & Evelyn accessories). It took us approximately an hour and 80 GBP for getting to the hotel by taxi from Heathrow airport. However, the DLR to South Quay and the Jubilee line stations are located very near to the hotel entrance which is to say that the hotel is reachable in 5 mins and is also clearly visible just as you walk the bridge from Canary Wharf main station. Our room on the 13thfloor, great views of river and London, room is spacious and newly decorated in minimal design. The bathroom was also large and had bathtub and shower. We had breakfast at the Execytive Lounge on the 14th floor and it but it was delicious and with many choices (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cereals, yoghurt, croissants, really nice cappuccino!) I would like to mention Maria from the concierge desk for her kindness and attention during our second evening when I came up with a bad cough and fever. She immediately sent someone to buy a thermometer (as they didn't have one!) and she was really helpful to cater for our needs. A BIG thanks to Maria and the guy (can't remember his name) who went out at 8 p.m. to buy me a thermometer!) Staff deserves congrats!!! As for the location, it is very good for Canary Wharf as well as for tourists who do not mind staying off the main London center and its hussle. Bond street is about 30 minutes by train (Jubille line) and the hotel is linked through a bridge that takes you to the Canary Wharf Underground station and shopping mall in just a few minutes. I would definitely stay here again as I am not keen on more centrally located hotels with noise and hustle. Hilton Canary Wharf is quiet, friendly and good priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - pity about the extras”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy911
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through LastMinute.com. The room was great and the staff friendly and helpful. However, I was very disappointed to find that we had to pay for connection to the internet (£15 for 24 hours!) and for the use of films (all of which were just current blockbuster and therefore of little interest). It seemed a shame that the hotel was trying to charge for extras. And the minibar was prohibitive. Even small b & bs realise the pleasure guests have in being offered little complimentary extras. I thought it was worth bringing up, because it spoiled what was a very nice weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “100% Customer Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: swampy73
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that the Hilton at Canary Wharf was one of the best hotels i have stayed in. The service was fantastic, helpful and not complicated. The room was massive, clean and nicely presented. Breakfast, well you could off stayed all day and still never finished what was on offer. Great choice and well presented. Even going to the point of making poached eggs fresh and bringing them to you without fuss. Restaraunt is also reasonable and good food. As an alternative though if you go right out of the door to the river side you will find a Turkish Restaraunt called Haza. Absoulently out of this world and for peanuts. Stay here stay nowhere else if in this side of town. 6 miles from Covert Garden, great tube links easy to get to by car. No Fuss. Oh yeah and i got two rooms with bed and breakfast £173.00 off Lastminute.com as a top secret hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: moonbather
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights and the thing that makes this hotel stand apart from others is the staff who we always smiling and very welcoming and helpful. Stayed in a standard room on reflection, being HHonors members, we were disappointed not to get an upgrade. Room was lovely and big, but have realised since we came home we didn't get bathrobes and the room description mentions a coffee maker, we didn't seem to get one of those in the room either. This aside it is a great hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but not entirely faultless.”
Reviews.Author: MP1Dublin
Reviews.Content: TOP MARKS! This a a great hotel with several transport links to central London so I'd have no hesitation recommending it for business or pleasure regardless of it's location. Canary wharf is stunning if slightly soul-less and and eeriely empty at the weekends but the Hilton has a wonderful aspect and it boasts superb views over the Thames and the City. Turn right out the front door and cross the footbridge to reach Heron Quay or Canary wharf DLR stations, the lattter accessed via the shopping mall which also leads to Canary WHarf Tube station but beware that the Jubilee line is notoriously unreliable . The DLR is an excellent alternative but there is a long walk to change lines in Bank. Left and left again out the front door brings you to South Quay DLR station in seconds. London transport options are extensive but also expensive! We didn't check the river transport options but will definitely do so next time! The hotel is ultra cool and the staff are excellent. Updgrade if you can because it is well worth it for the executive lounge access alone. We were initally offered a 14th floor executive suite with large L shaped living/dining room for £99 per night which plus tax was a wee bit too rich for our budget but happily when we realised that room was non-smoking they readilly "down-graded" us to a smoking Junior Suite which was more than adequate and at £49 extra per night it was more much better value. Our base room price was £104 including taxes. The top floor suites should be cheaper. The executive lounge is wonderful. It serves a splendid breakfast buffet which includes cooked options such as bacon, sausage, scrambled egg and hash browns, as well as a massive array of cereals, fruit and pastries.Not quite the full English but much more than continental! Afternoon tea comprised cuccumber/salmon sanwhich slices and huge selection of cakes & cookies. To cap it all there is a happy hour with a free bar and hot canapes between 6 and 9pm - magnificent! Remarkably the free bar included several types of bottled beer & wine including a superb sparkling Austrailian and every type of spirits including Baileys - all pour your own. The highly attentive staff immediatley replaced any empty wine/spirits and were not at all offended if you asked them to do so - so the booze really did flow freely and thankfully only one idiot abused it. This guy desrves a special mention. He was a pig. He hogged the bubbly to the extent that he actaully drank it by the neck at one stage shortly before he and his wife were politely expelled in a quite proffessional manner. Perhaps this could've and should've happened sooner because he was clearly attracting attention and annoying all of the other guests. It wasn't until he started eating directly from the buffet with his fingers and drooling over the food that he staff finally sprank into action. None-the-les the young girl in attendance handled things with aplomb! Saturday 29th of August 2010 FYI. We wont let this incident sully our memory of the otherwise excellent ambiance in the executive lounge which was a perfect retreat from which to watch planes banking over the city as boats whisk up and down the Thames and the sun sets over Tower Bridge and the London Eye. We will return for this reason alone. This Hiltons minor faults are the extortionate internet rates at £15 per day altough this is slightly negated by the three free computers in the exec lounge. Also, I booked two consecutive nights seperately when I realised my wife could accompany me and I could extend a Friday business trip through to Sunday. This caused untold, unecessary and frankly unacceptable confusion. I explained this during a FORTY minute phonecall prior to our arrival, again upon check in and AGAIN when we arrived back second day to find we'd been locked out of our room. Finally, as cash paying customers who had fully prepaid for our stay we were appalled to be asked for an additional cash deposit on the second night. We ate out and spent quite a lot of money else where as a result which probably worked out in our favour because drinks in the hotel bar are extremely expensive. None-the-less the Hitlon Canary Wharf is an excellent Hotel and we look forward to returning despite these very minor flaws. In-fact it is now our first choice destination in London! TOP MARKS!

Reviews.Title: “A great option for those looking for a Hilton-branded hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: It is my fourth time in London and 3rd time at a Hilton hotel. So far, I have always liked the Hilton's I have stayed at (London Bridge and Park Lane) and the Hilton London Canary Wharf was another enjoyable place to stay in London. I would say that other than location, this is probably one of the Hilton offering the best value in London - especially if staying during the week-end. As Canary Wharf is somewhat of a business area, rooms are available at deep discounts for week-end stays As a Diamond member, I was upgraded to the executive floor. The executive lounge experience is nice with great staff and a decent assortment of food throughout the day (breakfast, tea time, dinner). I was particularily pleased with the breakfast and tea time offering. One thing that I was not too impressed with though is the iBanh service that is used for web browsing (complimentary) in the lounge. It is a bit sluggish and prone to bugs... The Hilton London Canary Wharf has a contemporary look and the rooms reflect this. Room size was good and the bathroom + amenities were superior. Although I did not use it, the hotel also features a complete gym. There are some decent views from the hotel / executive lounge and you might be able to get a few great pictures with a poweful zoom. Location is not that bad if transit is operating normally. It is less than 5 minutes from the South Quay DLR station, less than 10 minutes from the Canary Wharf tube station (Jubilee Line - which will bring you along the most major sights) and approx. 15 minutes from the Thames Clipper boats. However, if you are there during a week-end and that the Tube is shut down for repair, it could take you twice as much time to where you need to go. At a small discount vs the Hilton London Tower hotel, I would not hesitate to stay there again and make it my #1 Hilton location in London

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended Hotel - Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Susie66Chester
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from a 3 night break to London where we were booked into the Hilton Canary Wharf. I wish to pass on my comments and thanks to the Hotel Management and staff. The staff should be highly commended for their professionalism and the way we were welcomed by reception and the breakfast staff every day. The Breakfast staff worked tirelessly to make sure that all guests were looked after and nothing was too much trouble for them We were booked into room on the 11th floor, the room was spotlessly clean, quiet and spacious. We both slept soundily on all three nights. We have stayed in many Hotels mostly 5 star and would rate our stay at Canary Wharf as one of the best. Thank you for once again and we look forward to returning soon. The Location was very easy for the tube station and we were in the centre of London within 15 mins. The area around the hotel felt very safe with lots of nice places to eat and have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say...”
Reviews.Author: stevenrose23
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hilton, our expectations were high. I had stayed in this chain all over the world, and always received good service. Needless to say we were not dissapointed. The receptionist welcomed us with a smile, and our room was ready before the stated 3pm check in time. The room was styled to perfection - modern and very spacious. Breakfast was impeccable, buffet style and continental, with all the waiters providing excellent service. There really isn't a bad thing to say about this hotel, except maybe the location. The Jubilee line was closed when we visited, so we had to get the Clipper or the DLR to Bank station and then switch. It didn't prove to problematic, and if the Jubilee line is operating, then it would be ideal, as Westminster etc are all on the same line. Really would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No, I do not want fries with that!”
Reviews.Author: theNaviga2r
Reviews.Content: My stay was not very good. After an arduous 24 hour journey, when it was clear to the receptionist that I was very tired and in need of a rest, I was bombarded with suggestions to upgrade. Even after I made it clear that all I wanted was to go to a room and rest, they continued to encourage we to take a room with a view at extra cost. It felt like being in McDonalds and asking if I want fries with my meal. Only a helluva lot more expensive. At the end of my stay I needed a car to Heathrow, and the hotel directed the car to the wrong terminal, even though they said they would call and confirm which terminal my flight was departing from. Bad bookends to an otherwise comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tomas0804
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Hilton Canary Wharf for an extended birthday weekend. What a great surprise it was to find out on the check in that they not only noticed my note about this special occasion but as well upgraded us to executive level with all the amenities included. Canary Wharf Hilton is a modern business hotel located just in the middle of the business district only 5 mins walk from metro,DLR stop,shops and bars. We stayed in an executive room on the top 13th floor. The room was spacious with contemporary decor and great views. The bed was spacious and mazing to sleep on and the bathroom was just stunning with both bath tub and shower and the highest standard sanitary. Entire room was spotlessly clean, included all necessary mods and cons and even complimentary bottles of water. We enjoyed as well the services of the executive lounge with it's complimentary drinks and snacks, internet facilities, ambient atmosphere and stunning views on the river Thames and London city. What is absolutely necessary to mention is the level and quality of the service we received from entire staff of the hotel. Started at the check-in, continued on breakfast (which is great buffet style with huge choice)with restaurant staff, concierge ..basically whoever we came in contact with was extremely helpful, professional, knowledgeable and polite. Some extraordinary service we received from Pei Ling at the executive lounge desk who wasn't only welcoming and provided answer on each of our question but as well promptly helped us with our duplicate reservation issue. Summa summarum Hilton Canary Wharf Hotel was so far the best hotel we stayed in with ultimately most professional service of the highest quality. I just hope they will keep their standard and would be delighted to return again and recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location business travellers and O2, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: antzero
Reviews.Content: Located south of Canary Wharf and a few minutes walk from Heron Quays or South Quay on the DLR the hotel was easy to get too. Ideally located for Canary Wharf and The O2, and perfect for our trip this hotel may be somewhat out of the way for Central London tourists. Check-in was queue free and very friendly. We stayed in room 1108 with a reasonable view of the surrounding high-rises. The room was clean with modern decor and had a new room smell! The aircon is nice and quiet and not dry air. The two, single beds were right next to each other, not a problem for us, but if you don't want to get too close you can always make a wall with the pillows! Room amenities were ok. It would be nice to have toothbrushes and toothpaste, but a quick call sorted some out. The free optional towels and pillows were waiting in the room. The fancy bath plug was broken which I noted on the comment card, along with my thanks for the good service. The following day I received an email from the Guest Relations Manager as a follow-up which was nice. The best bit for me was the breakfast service: super, friendly staff. The range of food was very good: the usual fry ups, freshly made eggs then fruit, cereal, various fruit juices, danishes, yoghurts, some bran yoghurt stuff, smoked fish plus kippers, more fish, waffles and other items available to order. The coffee was good :) We chose the hotel on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and the positive ones certainly echo our experience. Also, the price was very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Neasham
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from an excellent weeknd break at the Hilton Canary Wharf, London. The check-in was straightforward and from the moment we entered the hotel the staff were friendly, attentive and efficient. Our Deluxe Queen room (no 917) was very spacious, even though it contained a bed, sofa, easy chair with foot stool and desk. The bathroom was a bit small, but was smart and clean and contained a full bath, shower, bathrobes, slippers and Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. An excellent buffet breakfast was included in our rate (£20.95 if paid for separately), with lots of choice of hot and cold foods available, served by friendly staff. The Canary Wharf complex, with up-market shops and cafes and the Docklands Light Railway are only a few minutes walk away. We had an excellent meal in an Indian restaurant on West Ferry Road called the Clifton. It was very reasonably priced and only a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: Treborwf
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great location for Canary Wharf, for central London I would stay somewhere closer. Upgraded to Executive room as a Gold honors member. Fantastic lounge on the 14th floor, views of London great, three computers and large enough that on every visit managed to find a seat. Only negative (apart from location to central London), the television in the room was tiny, so tiny that I expected to find a keyboard in front of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystal2680
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June for a long weekend to see Bon Jovi at the O2 Arena. The staff we friendly and helpful and the room was ready for the 3pm check in as advised on the hotel's website. We stayed in one of the "Guest Rooms" and were really surprised at how big a spacious the room and bathroom were. The Location was great, and we both very extremely safe walking to the hotel at night. The O2 arena and Jubilee Line were really close and travelling to the other attractions London has to offer was really easy. We would like to come back to London and see some more of the sites, everything about this hotel was great and we would most definately stay at this hotel rather than others closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: mooresrp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because my company's other preferred choices were booked. I was encouraged by the hotel's appearance, thinking that if the staff took as great of care in preparing the exterior that they would also take great care of their customers. I could not have been more wrong. In the two months I stayed, I had repeated trouble with their front desk staff and billing office. Their policy is to allow your bill to accumulate to a certain point and then pick an arbitrary date on which they would charge a certain amount. This is difficult for business travelers as we often have to itemize our bills and account for every expense on the date it was incurred. I explained the problems this practice was causing me to the billing office and front desk personnel and asked if they could notify me when they were going to charge me so I could prepare my finance reports. All I got in return was a blank stare and "I'm sorry"...no explanation or acknowledgment that this practice was causing one of their long-term guests issues. Furthermore, the billing office charged my corporate card 14 times in one day when trying to secure payment (per their idiotic billing protocols) despite my asking them to delay by 2 days so that I could secure additional credit. These 14 charges amount to well over $20,000 and caused my card to be declined for several days. Again, when I expressed my discontent, all they could offer was a blank stare and an empty "I'm sorry". The pros of this hotel include a decent gym and modern rooms. The food is edible, but not great. If this is how the hotel staff and management treat their long-term Diamond VIP guests, I'd hate to see how they treat people who are on vacation. I'd avoid this place if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Weekend break in London.”
Reviews.Author: lorddodo
Reviews.Content: All good apart from our room was not ready when we arrived-12 noon and we ended going in to London to kill time until it did become available to us. Also unidentifiable hair in our bath tub. Breakfast buffet fantastic with something for everyone-veggies, vegans and carnivores alike-with excellent service. Ideal location being only a 20 minute tube ride from the main Museums in South Kensington. Staff friendly and welcoming. Would go back due to great staff, food and location. Price not bad either-very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Margaritata
Reviews.Content: New hotel with a nice atmosphere, great big rooms. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bob-a-JobSussex
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay via Hotel Pronto for an excellent low price. Our room was large, well furnished and quiet, with comfortable beds and nice bathroom. The buffet breakfast included in our rate was exceptional. A huge selection and everying fresh and good quality. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay but not our last!”
Reviews.Author: GirlsAboutTown
Reviews.Content: A return trip to this hotel did not disappoint, although we missed the luxury of the Executive Lounge this time around (budget!). Twin room was spacious and spotless, although carpet looking a bit worn in our room. There was no noise whatsoever at night time, despite the hotel being very busy. We requested bath robes and slippers and these were delivered promptly. Turn down service made for a welcome return in the evening. Complimentary water a nice idea. Breakfast excellent with a choice of everything you could wish for. The only thing that marred our trip, and this was not the fault of the hotel, was that the Jubilee Line was closed the entire weekend so we needed to be a bit creative in finding ways of getting into the centre. Try the boat from the Four Seasons hotel - a lovely trip. South Quay station is two minutes walk and you can then change at Bank although it's a long walk to the other lines! I can't really think of any reason why I would stay at another hotel in London having discovered this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TommyBBB
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, very clean and smart. Everything you would expect from a Hilton. Although it is not in the centre of London there are places to go to eat nearby. Nice and quiet at the weekend and only a short tube ride into the centre. I would stay here everytime I visit London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: indodutch
Reviews.Content: great hotel great staff great workout room and steamroom great breakfast buffet great rooms and beds what else you want and close to jubilee line which is quick to downtown and soho at all costs avoid the hilton across the river

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique style on a big scale”
Reviews.Author: Glitch33
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a one night stay in Canary Wharf to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I pushed the boat out and went for the King Size Executive room on the weekend rate. I booked on he Hilton website an hour before we arrived, very smooth and efficient. I didn't like the fact they add the tax on afterwards so the prices do look a bit misleading to start. The check in process was quick and easy. I could have gone direct to to the 14th floor to check in at the executive lounge but the ground floor reception was empty. Reception looked quite small and could be congested during the week but on this saturday it was fine. The onsite basement car park is £20 per 24 hours on a first come first served basis. The concierge was helpful and gave us a local map and offered to point out where we wanted to go. The hotel is conveniently located for all the central Canary Wharf shops, restaurants and bars. All are a short walk away. Our room on the 14th floor was a good size, clean, new and modern. It had everything we needed, including a good view of the river and docklands skyline. A couple of small bottles of complimentary water were gratefullly received and a nice touch. The flat screen TV needs to be bigger but was adequate. TV channels were OK and included Sky Sports 1 and 2 which is an added bonus. The lighting was good and the blackout curtains were very effective on a bright sunny morning. The bed, duvet and pillows were good quality and gave a good nights sleep. The excellent bathroom was large with a separate bath tub and large shower cubicle. The toilet was a bit close to the wall at the side but this is only a minor problem. The power of the shower was a bit disappointing but it did the job. Complimentary toiletries from Crabtree and Evelyn were high quality and put to good use. Bath towels were large and fluffy, in fact too fluffy and bits came off! This is a minor fault that will presumably sort itself out. In addition there were big bath robes and slippers. We used the exec lounge for complimentary afternoon tea and pre-dinner drinks. The lounge is comfortable, has great views of the city and had very pleasant and friendly staff. They could do with a few more comfy chairs as i suspect it gets busy during the business week. The food and drink selection were fine and in my opinion worth the extra cost. We used the bar on the ground floor after we had been out for a meal at Jamies Italian (see my review). The bar is a modern style and best if you can grab a comfy sofa rather than the square stools, or high bar stools which look a bit uncomfortable to a man of my age. Service was OK but they looked a bit understaffed and had to clear the table for us to it down. I assume they have more staff during the business week when it gets busy. I made the mistake of pre-paying an extra £15 for the two of us to have the full breakfast in the ground floor restaurant. The exec lounge only does a continental style inclusive breakfast, or so I thought. They did actually have hash browns, bacon, sausage and scrambled egg which would have been enough for us. The full price for breakfast in the main restaurant is £20.95. Call me a tight wad but that price is extortionate and the quality at best was average. I had to get my coffee replaced because it was served luke warm. Maybe a one off and the waitress did apologise. I should have asked the chef to fry some fresh eggs for me. I mistakenly took the dried up ones on display and they were not good. If they want to charge top dollar for the brekkie they need to improve the quality and choice considerably to get anywhere near value for money. If I return I would eat out or upgrade to the exec floor again. The hotel is modern and stylish and has a boutique look and feel to it. Despite one or two little niggles I would return to this hotel and upgrade to the Executive floor if I can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury in the heart of Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: bpbindaas
Reviews.Content: I was here in July 2009 on a business trip with one of the "high banks". The best thing about the place is its location. Situated in south quay near the Tube and the DLR, it is perfect for the business traveller to the Canary Wharf. The hotel is equipped with everything that a business visitor needs: Wired and wireless internet access (free wi-fi would have been great though), a gym and a huge conference facility. The fare at the inhouse restaurant is different and worth trying. The room service could have been better considering the amount you shell out. I once ordered for room delivery of food and it was cold by the time it was in my room. Overall 4/5. The location is over everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Opinion”
Reviews.Author: bartek3net
Reviews.Content: In my opinion that's a good hotel, good place to rest. Very easy access to Metro or DLR. 10min far from city center by mixing DLR with Underground ;) You find anything you want in room (TV, phone, bar etc.). I can say like every other hotel but with a little bit more. I've asked for swimming pool but they haven't got one, but they have gym, sauna. U like healthy life, there's place for you - breakfast by ur choice - open kitchen. Good place to go if you want see london ;)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunflower
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with a friend from overseas. We chose this location as we were going to a concert at the O2, however, it proved to be great for shopping and eating out too, which made the trip more leisurely as we ususally have to cram a trip up to the West End for shopping. The Hotel is literally 5 mins away from some of our fav stores such as Karen Millen so we were more than made up! The rooms are very business like, but roomy. The bed was comfortable but small and very low? (we had a double bed). The fitness centre is also very good, we used the steam room, and the gym which was very well equipped with plenty of fresh towels and modern equipment. The only negative is that the hotel food is quite pricey with a 5.00 room service charge; breakfast is 20.00 per head - however, there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “superb!!”
Reviews.Author: loppys
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a one night stay, it is quite possibly the nicest hotel we have stayed in!! (although we don't get out much!!) joking aside the place was spotlessly clean and the staff were all brilliant and as for breakfast.... it is ideal for the O2 but a little bit out of the centre of London but saying that it is easy to get to from town on the jubilee line!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel if you don't mind its location”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in new area, one of the best Hiltons in London. The average-sized rooms are tidy, comfortable, fairly bright, with every amenity (plumbing, lighting, ventilation) in good working order, a major advantage of a new building. View over the wharf is fair, but there is not much activity on this section of the river. This hotel's location is perfect for those who have business in the area. For tourists, the proximity to London City airport (easily accessible by train) and Tube station makes it a viable compromise, especially on weekends when rates are much lower (very good value for London). A favorable mention for the executive lounge, where the evening snacks were somewhat above average, and staff hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ClairabelleIreland
Reviews.Content: Having just read the review by the person from California which will probably be the rant below mine, I feel that that person is from another planet. (But then don't they say that California is another planet). Take it from one very fussy customer who knows her stuff in the hospitality sector , this hotel and its staff are first rate, exceptional and go beyond the call of duty. We were upgraded to an executive room on the 12th floor. We were greeted by the fabulous Sonia in the Executive Lounge and both she and her colleague could not have been more pleasant and efficient. Our room was beautiful, spotless and every amentity catered for. The gesture of two beautiful slices of cake for my husband's birthday was more akin to a grand stately country house hotel - not a busy business hotel. Breakfast was great, both in the Cinnamon Restaurant and the Executive Lounge with all staff being courteous and friendly. Thanks to the great breakfast chef for a fabulous omelette. Canary Wharf is a little way outside of London....anyone who does their research and can read a map would have that sussed before their visit. Yes it is in the Financial District but what a superb area to stay in, clean, smart with fabulous restaurants and wine bars. There is nothing not to like. It was actually a relief after a long day in the crowded west end to hop onto a Thames Clipper and glide down the river to Canary Wharf. Thank you to Sonia and all the staff at the Hilton Canary Wharf, we had a fantastic weekend and really the Hilton at Canary Wharf should be in the top ten of London Hotels. I am off to try the Hilton Malta next.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: 3X3
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I've been visiting London since 1974 and have been there several times. So I have some experience with the city and hotels there. I stayed at the Hilton London Canary Wharf for six nights using a Hilton Hhonors reward. I wanted to stay at the Hilton Park Lane (where I've stayed before), but they would not guarantee me a non-smoking room, even though I tried to make the reservation seven months prior. I stayed in an executive floor room and had use of the executive lounge. The positives for this hotel are that it’s quiet, the maid service is very good, and it's rather new so most things are functional. The bathroom had a separate shower and tub, which was nice. There was a safe in the room. The worst thing about the Hilton London Canary Wharf, in my opinion, is its location. I'm told that this is the new financial center for London, and if you have business here, it would be convenient. But if you're visiting London, as I was, it's a terrible location, sort of like staying in Newark to visit Manhattan. You'll waste from 15 to 30 minutes getting to and from central London to stay at this hotel. And while the area is obviously one of intense recent development, it seems to have been hit hard by the current economic downturn as most projects are stalled and there is a plethora of empty offices, storefronts, and residences. At night, the area is dead, and there is really nothing of interest for the tourist here. As for the hotel itself, it's modern, but lacks charm. It's a triumph of cold design over comfort and functionality. The lobby consists mainly of a few chairs and couches with many little ottomans appropriate for small children, but not adults. The rooms are similar, but, for London, they're fairly decent, but nothing special. The thermostat in my room did not work so I had no heat the first night, and the room was very cold. They "fixed" the thermostat the second day I was there, but it would only heat when turned to the maximum (24C) and then the heat would not turn off. So the room could be kept at 60F or 90F, but not between those extremes. There is very little space for putting things (other than in the closet). The bathroom has no practical hooks for towels, so I had to use the clothesline for hanging towels. Several of the towels had holes in them. There is a hairdryer supplied, but you can't use it in the bathroom because of the plug type; instead, you have to use it by the desk at the extreme opposite end of the room. There is a refrigerator, but you're not allowed to use it for any of your own items; it's only for things the hotel wants to sell you. The lights on and near the bed are impractical and difficult to read by. There is a small flat screen TV, but the picture quality of the one in my room was so bad that it was unwatchable. Internet connection is £15 a day, but there's free access in the executive lounge. When I checked in, I was asked if I would like a daily newspaper, and I requested the "Financial Times" but I never received a paper, even though I saw them delivered to other rooms. The executive lounge is small and, with a very few exceptions, the food was mediocre at best. This lounge was nowhere as good as the one at the Park Lane, where the offerings for tea are exceptional. As for the personnel, they were a mixed bag. Some were nice and helpful, others were simply nasty. For several of them, English is a second language and I found them very difficult to understand. At no time did I think any of them cared about me or whatever I was inquiring about. I found the concierge particularly unhelpful. I've stayed in several executive rooms at Hiltons in various cities and used the executive lounges in these hotels. In my experience, the Hilton London Canary Warf is the worst of these. Overall I'm very sorry that I stayed here and I feel as if I've wasted an award stay. While I understand that different people have different expectations and interpret experiences in different ways, I could not recommend this hotel to anyone in good faith. I chose to stay here when I couldn't get a non-smoking room at the Park Lane because of the TripAdvisor reviews and ratings which, when I made the reservation, placed this hotel at #7 in London. Although the rating has now dropped considerably, it is still rated way too highly in my opinion. Having had several negative experiences at Hilton properties during the past year, I'm thinking of abandoning the Hilton program altogether, particularly as they keep raising the points for free nights. This stay was 240,000 points, and it takes some time to get this, more than this stay was worth to me. I'm also questioning the value of the reviews on TripAdvisor as all the positive reviews for the Hilton London Canary Warf make me think that I was in a different universe.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Stef1940
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful on check-in and the rooms big clean and the bed comfortable. The location of the hotel out of central London, means that you can get a better standard of room for the price you would pay in inner London.It is easy and quick to get to all the major attractions in the city. The area around the hotel is very modern with many outside bars for any beverages. Under Canary Wharf is a massive shopping complex. The breakfast bar at the Hotel is first class, with everything one requires.

Reviews.Title: “I reccommend this hotel for ease of...”
Reviews.Author: Redcroft27
Reviews.Content: I reccommend this hotel for ease of access to the 02 arena but would not reccommend this to my friends for any other reason. The room was pretty average but it lacked the basics (sewing kit, extra pillows) when we asked at reception we were met with dumbfounded looks and the concierge intervened and scrambled for a needle and thread and saftey pin... No pillows as they were full?! The lobby was well maintained and functional, bar was a normal good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for weekend trip to London”
Reviews.Author: gmhaggis
Reviews.Content: This is primarily a business hotel, which is no surprise given the location right next to Canary Wharf. But, book in advance and you should be able to get greatly reduced weekend rates. Although located in the East end, in the docklands/Canary Wharf area of London, a few minutes walk will give you access to the tube (Jubilee Line) or DLR getting you into central London in around 15-20 minutes. The hotel is a typical Hilton chain hotel. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with complimentary tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast, which was included in my rate, was and English breakfast and continental buffet. Great for getting you started in the morning. Only wired internet is available in the rooms. It is expensive at £16 for 24hours. I think there was wireless in the public areas, but I didn't try it. Checkin was quick and hastle free. Staff polite and friendly. Nearby is the Canary Wharf shopping mall - reasonable selection of coffee bars and eateries. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would also consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR THE O2”
Reviews.Author: mandyh66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night because we were attending a concert at the O2. Didn't really know the area so was unsure how far it was from the venue but it is very easy to get to from this hotel, the tube is a 10 min stroll away and North Greenwich is one stop away (this is the station for the O2). Now to the hotel, it is every bit as good as other reviews have stated. We stayed in a twin executive room on 13th floor (1302) this has a fantastic view of the river and over towards the city (great at night). You get lots of extras staying in an executive room including entry to the executive lounge which offers complimentary beverages, drinks and your own check in. The rooms are very modern and extremely clean. The bathroom is a good size with separate bath and shower, with complimentary Crabtree & Evelyn La Source toiletries. We also had tea & coffee facilities in the room with biscuits and 2 bottles of complimentary water. There is a well stocked mini bar in the room, prices are a little steep but just what you expect in hotels anyway and is certainly cheaper than some of the hotels that I have stayed in! In the morning we had breakfast included, which was buffet style and you will certainly not go hungry after eating in here! They had a hot counter which included all the usual items but included black pudding, hagis, has browns, waffles etc. You could also have omlettes to order. On another counter they offer all types of cereals, breads, bagels, fresh fruit, cheeses, cold meats, smoked salmon etc etc, I could go on and on, so much choice. Also whilst you are sitting at your table you are always being asked if you would like more juice and they fill the glass for you. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly at the hotel and they have on site parking for 25 cars which is very secure at £20 per night. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Not a criticism of this hotel,but it is adjacent to Canary Wharf meaning that staying here you are a bit isolated. That said, the DLR station and the Jubuilee line is about a five ninute walk away in opposite directions, but be waware that the Jubilee line is freqently out of service due to various works. Service at the hotel was very friendly and good; the staff was very accomodating. My room was fine, but nothing exciting. My room seemed very large with open space, as if some furniture was missing; no complaint though. Interent access is expensive at GBP15 per day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, well worth the travel.”
Reviews.Author: Diamond32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again, this is our second time at this particular hotel. First impressions are excellent, very attentive staff and stunning hotel. We had the queen size room which is very large and comfortable, has all the mod cons, Wifi, air con, flat screen, alarm, complimentary teas/coffees/ bottled water etc. Lovely bathroom with robes and slippers! The bar is very sophisticated but comfortable (rather expensive as expected!) The breakfast was lovely and had superb choices. Wonderful hotel to use only a couple of quibbles! 1 - A bit of a trek but worth it for the room sizes and the fact that its relaxing in that part of London. 2 - They have great mirrors in the rooms but the lighting is really is crap! found it hard to do my make up in the dim lights, very romantic though! The bathroom mirror is hard to use with the basin in front of you so couldn't get close enough. Apart from that no complaints, great weekend yet again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gowestfan
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel as a stopover as we were going to a concert at the o2. The hotel is lovely quite difficult to find if you drive there parking is under the hotel and is £20 for 24 hours . Check in was quite slow lots of people checking in at the same time. Our room was on the 11th floor and had a lovely view the room was very clean and large with a queen Anne bed very comfy.To get to the O2 either use the tube getting a day unlimited ticket or use the clipper boat which is not very far to walk to catch and it takes you right to the O2 . All in all a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel - highly reccomend!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnobUk
Reviews.Content: My first Hilton experience and I have to say it was very very nice, we booked a standard room but the amount of space in the room was terrific, loads of space, lovely and clean, it had a great feel to the room. The TV in our room wasn't working properly so a member of staff offered for us to change rooms but we couldn't be bothered and declined so instead she sent us a bottle of wine instead which I thought was good service.
